info.name: Spinal cord, anterior columns
info.description: The anterior columns or funiculi are AKA ventral columns or funiculi. Portion of the white matter of the spinal cord that extends from the ventral (or anterior) median fissure to the ventral lateral sulcus, i.e. the point of exit of the ventral roots from the spinal cord. Present bilaterally, it ontains several tracts, most of which originate at higher levels of the neuraxis. However, part of the clinically important spinothalamic tract is located in this funiculus.
